articles.headline: Lawmakers Regulate Banks, Then Flock to Them
articles.snippet: Migration has grown from Congress to financial firms that are trying to stave off greater federal regulation.
articles.abstract: Migration has grown from Congress to financial firms that are trying to stave off greater federal regulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Barney Frank publicly rebuked a former aide this month for taking a job with a big Wall Street firm right after drafting a regulation that could affect the way the firm does business. Mr. Frank described it as an unusual transgression, one that embarrassed others working on the legislation and created at least the appearance of a conflict of interest.

articles.headline: Banks Making Big Profits From Tiny Loans
articles.snippet: Despite its saintly aura, microfinancing is dominated by larger banks that often charge high interest rates.
articles.abstract: Despite its saintly aura, microfinancing is dominated by larger banks that often charge high interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: In recent years, the idea of giving small loans to poor people became the darling of the development world, hailed as the long elusive formula to propel even the most destitute into better lives.

articles.headline: An Insurer’s New Approach to Diabetes
articles.snippet: A clinically tested program, in which losing 5 percent of body weight cut the risk of Type 2 diabetes by more than half, will be expanded to Y.M.C.A.’s in seven cities.
articles.abstract: A clinically tested program, in which losing 5 percent of body weight cut the risk of Type 2 diabetes by more than half, will be expanded to Y.M.C.A.’s in seven cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: This could be one glimpse of the future of health insurance.

articles.headline: Lexus Stops Selling S.U.V. That Was Called Unsafe
articles.snippet: Toyota temporarily halted sales after Consumer Reports said the Lexus GX 460 had a problem that could lead to a rollover.
articles.abstract: Toyota temporarily halted sales after Consumer Reports said the Lexus GX 460 had a problem that could lead to a rollover.
articles.lead_paragraph: Toyota quickly suspended sales of its 2010 Lexus GX 460 sport utility vehicle on Tuesday after Consumer Reports magazine warned buyers that the model had a dangerous handling problem that could lead to a rollover and possibly “serious injury or death.”

articles.headline: Yes, 47% of Households Owe No Taxes. Look Closer.
articles.snippet: The portion of households that owe no income tax is a popular talking point on cable television and talk radio but relies on a cleverly selective reading of the facts.
articles.abstract: The portion of households that owe no income tax is a popular talking point on cable television and talk radio but relies on a cleverly selective reading of the facts.

articles.headline: Banks Resist Plans to Reduce Mortgage Balances
articles.snippet: An official at JPMorgan Chase said mortgage reductions could reward households for taking on more debt than they could afford and was simply unworkable.
articles.abstract: An official at JPMorgan Chase said mortgage reductions could reward households for taking on more debt than they could afford and was simply unworkable.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a rebuff to the Obama administration, two big banks on Tuesday drew a line in the sand on cutting the mortgage balances of beleaguered homeowners, saying that the tool would be applied sparingly.

articles.headline: JPMorgan Upbeat as It Posts Profit
articles.snippet: With the bank’s first-quarter income up 55 percent, its chief raised his outlook on the broader economy.
articles.abstract: With the bank’s first-quarter income up 55 percent, its chief raised his outlook on the broader economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: For big banks, the good news just keeps coming.

articles.headline: U.S. Forces Close Post in Afghan ‘Valley of Death’
articles.snippet: Closing the Korangal Outpost after four years was a tacit admission that setting up a base in the isolated valley was a mistake.
articles.abstract: Closing the Korangal Outpost after four years was a tacit admission that setting up a base in the isolated valley was a mistake.
articles.lead_paragraph: KORANGAL OUTPOST, Afghanistan — The last American soldier left here Wednesday, abandoning a base surrounded by tall cedar trees and high mountains, in a place that came to be called the Valley of Death.
